content:
Yes, many MLIS programs offer part-time or online options for students who have work or family responsibilities. Here are a few examples:

1. San Jose State University: San Jose State University has an entirely online MLIS program designed to fit the schedules of working professionals. 

2. University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign: The MLIS program at the University of Illinois offers an online option, and part-time enrollment is available.

3. Rutgers University: Rutgers University's MLIS program has both on-campus and online options, which includes part-time options.

4. Drexel University: Drexel University offers an online MLIS program option that can be completed in two years of full-time study or can be pursued part-time.

5. University of North Texas: The University of North Texas offers an online MLIS program that has a part-time flexible option for students.

These are just a few examples, and many other universities also offer online and part-time options. It's worth noting that some programs may have on-campus requirements or in-person components for certain courses, so be sure to research each program's requirements and offerings.
